problem.title: CheckPoint: Yo-Yo - Part 1
problem.p: A yo-yo has mass m and a moment of inertia \(I\) measured with respect to an axis perpendicular to the screen and passing through its center of mass. A light thin string is wrapped around the central part of the yo-yo that has radius \(r\). The string is attached to the ceiling as shown. The yo-yo is released from rest and begins to descend as the string unwraps. The coordinate system used is shown in the diagram.

If the force of tension in the string has a magnitude T, and the acceleration of the center of mass has a magnitude a, what is the correct expression that results from applying Newton's 2nd law on the motion of the center of mass of the yo-yo?
